alert.note: Alert for Barbour; Braxton; Clay; Lewis; Northwest Nicholas; Northwest Webster; Upshur (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 01 at 9:09PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of north central Nicholas, southeastern Lewis, Braxton, Upshur, northern Webster, northern Clay and southern Barbour Counties through 945 PM EDT... At 908 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 6 miles west of Buckhannon to near Gassaway. Movement was east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Buckhannon, Sutton, Clay, Audra State Park, Belington, Gassaway, Birch River, Holly River State Park, Big Otter, Rock Cave, Wallback, Harrison, Junior, Flatwoods, Nebo, Alexander, Procious, Eden, Cleveland and Boggs. This includes the following highways... Interstate 79 between mile markers 34 and 75. Route 19 between mile markers 56 and 68. Route 33 between mile markers 2 and 17. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. To report severe weather, contact your nearest law enforcement agency. They will relay your report to the National Weather Service office in Charleston West Virginia.

area.areaDesc: Barbour; Braxton; Clay; Lewis; Northwest Nicholas; Northwest Webster; Upshur
